Nerangs.ab: yaθā ahū vairiiō čahār bār guftan pad yaθā ahū vairiiō fradom abarhāwan pad dar ī hāwan čīyōn xwaršēd gardēd bē gardēnišn pad š́iiaōθananąm ēk bār ud pad aŋhəuš ēk bār ud pad mazdāi ēk bār kōftan ud pad dudīgar yaθā ahū vairiiō ham pad ēn wāzagīhā harw ēk dō bār kōftan ud pad sidīgar yaθā ahū vairiiō ham pad ēn wāzagīhā harw ēk sē bār kōftan ēdōn kū pad fradom sē bār ud pad dudīgar šaš bār ud pad sidīgar nō bār kōftag bēd pad xšaθrəmcā sidīgar abarhāwan gōš bālā bē abrāzēnišn pad yaθā ahū vairiiō čahārom hōm ud urwarām hamē kōbišn

They should recite the yaθā ahū vairiiō four times. During the first yaθā ahū vairiiō, he has to turn the pestle over around the mortar in the direction in which the sun rotates and he should pound (the hōm and urwarām with the pestle) once at š́iiaōθananąm, once at aŋhə̄uš and once at mazdāi. During the second yaθā ahū vairiiō, at these same words, he should pound twice each time and during the third yaθā ahū vairiiō, at these same words, he should pound three times each time so that they pound three times during the first (yaθā ahū vairiiō), six during the second and nine during the third. At the third xšaθrəmcā, he has to raise the abarhāwan to the height of the ears. During the fourth yaθā ahū vairiiō, he has to continuously pound the hōm and the urwarām.

Quotations.ab: u-š pad ān 4 yatāhūwēryō 3 ud 6 ud 9 pad xšaθrəmcā ī sidīgar gōš bālāy ul dārišn az ān gyāg paydāg āθritīm xšaθrō.kərətahe gaōšō.bərəzō us.šāuuaiiōit̰.

At these four Ahuna Vairiia he has to pound (the mortar with the pestle) three, six and nine times. At xšaθrəmcā, he has to raise (the pestle) to the height of the ears, as it appears from the following passage: āθritīm xšaθrō.kərətahe gaōšō.bərəzō us.šāuuaiiōit̰

"At the four Ahuna Vairiia, (he has to pound) three, six and nine times; at the third xšaθrəmcā, he has to raise (the abarhāwan) to the height of his ears, as is evident from the following passage: āθritīm xšaθrō.kərətahe gaošō.bərəzō us.šāuuaiiōit̰."
